info.description: The PublicationIQ service provides the ability to search for publications designated as a part of a customer's collection.  Access to PublicationIQ requires a Publication Finder customer profile.  A profile password is optional.  If a password is supplied, it must be a valid password assigned to the Publication Finder customer profile.  If the password is omitted, the request will only be honored if the Publication Finder customer profile allows guest access in the environment where you are making the request.  For example, if you would like to make a request to PublicationIQ in the sandbox environment without a password, guest access must be enabled for the Publication Finder customer profile in the sandbox environment.  The same is true in the production environment.  The interactive documentation below uses the sandbox environment.  In order to gain access to the PublicationIQ sandbox environment, please contact EBSCO customer support.
info.title: EBSCO PublicationIQ

get.description: This resource allows you to retrieve a list of all packages from EPKB limited to a single customer ID. The response will reflect the context of the EBSCO customer ID included in the request.  Access to PublicationIQ requires a Publication Finder customer profile.  A profile password is optional.  If a password is supplied, it must be a valid password assigned to the Publication Finder customer profile.  If the password is omitted, the request will only be honored if the Publication Finder customer profile allows guest access in the environment where you are making the request.  For example, if you would like to make a request to PublicationIQ in the sandbox environment without a password, guest access must be enabled for the Publication Finder customer profile in the sandbox environment.  The same is true in the production environment.  This documentation uses the sandbox environment.  In order to gain access to the PublicationIQ sandbox environment, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: sessionid
parameters.description: Session ID.  If the Session ID is provided, it improves the experience of using the publications search.  sessionid is an optional parameter.

parameters.name: contenttype
parameters.description: Limits the results by type of package content. Valid values are all, aggregatedfulltext, abstractandindex, ebook, ejournal, print, unknown and onlinereference. It is also valid to use 0 for all, 1 for aggregated full text, 2 for abstract and index, 3 for ebook, 4 for ejournal, 5 for print, 6 for unknown or 7 for online reference.

parameters.name: profile
parameters.description: A valid EBSCO customer profile in the form of custid.groupid.profileid.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Profile Password (optional). If a password is supplied, it must be a valid password assigned to the customer profile. If omitted, the request will only be honored if the customer profile allows guest access.

get.description: This resource allows you to retrieve an Alpha Browser menu by locale ID and resource type.  Access to PublicationIQ requires a Publication Finder customer profile.  A profile password is optional.  If a password is supplied, it must be a valid password assigned to the Publication Finder customer profile.  If the password is omitted, the request will only be honored if the Publication Finder customer profile allows guest access in the environment where you are making the request.  For example, if you would like to make a request to PublicationIQ in the sandbox environment without a password, guest access must be enabled for the Publication Finder customer profile in the sandbox environment.  The same is true in the production environment.  This documentation uses the sandbox environment.  In order to gain access to the PublicationIQ sandbox environment, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: localeid
parameters.description: Locale Identifier.

parameters.name: sessionid
parameters.description: Session ID.  If provided, improves the experience of using the publications search. sessionid is an optional parameter.

parameters.name: resourcetype
parameters.description: Type of resource.  Valid values are book or journal.  It is also valid to use 0 for book or 1 for journal.

parameters.name: menuid
parameters.description: Menu ID. Used for filtering menus in position 1. The menu id must be a value greater than or equal to 65 and less than or equal to 90.

parameters.name: profile
parameters.description: A valid EBSCO customer profile in the form of custid.groupid.profileid.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Profile Password (optional). If a password is supplied, it must be a valid password assigned to the customer profile. If omitted, the request will only be honored if the customer profile allows guest access.

get.description: This resource allows you to search for packages and returns a list of packages from EPKB. The list is limited to a single customer ID. The response will reflect the context of the EBSCO customer ID included in the request.  Access to PublicationIQ requires a Publication Finder customer profile.  A profile password is optional.  If a password is supplied, it must be a valid password assigned to the Publication Finder customer profile.  If the password is omitted, the request will only be honored if the Publication Finder customer profile allows guest access in the environment where you are making the request.  For example, if you would like to make a request to PublicationIQ in the sandbox environment without a password, guest access must be enabled for the Publication Finder customer profile in the sandbox environment.  The same is true in the production environment.  This documentation uses the sandbox environment.  In order to gain access to the PublicationIQ sandbox environment, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: sessionid
parameters.description: Session ID.  If provided, improves the experience of using the publications search. sessionid is an optional parameter.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Keyword search that is applied to limit the results to packages that have the search term in the package name.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Page Offset. Starts at 1.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return in the response. Maximum count value is 100.

parameters.name: contenttype
parameters.description: Limits the results by type of package content. Valid values are all, aggregatedfulltext, abstractandindex, ebook, ejournal, print, unknown and onlinereference. It is also valid to use 0 for all, 1 for aggregated full text, 2 for abstract and index, 3 for ebook, 4 for ejournal, 5 for print, 6 for unknown or 7 for online reference.

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Valid values are packagename and relevance.

parameters.name: profile
parameters.description: A valid EBSCO customer profile in the form of custid.groupid.profileid.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Profile Password (optional). If a password is supplied, it must be a valid password assigned to the customer profile. If omitted, the request will only be honored if the customer profile allows guest access.

get.description: This resource allows you to retrieve a package by package ID.  Access to PublicationIQ requires a Publication Finder customer profile.  A profile password is optional.  If a password is supplied, it must be a valid password assigned to the Publication Finder customer profile.  If the password is omitted, the request will only be honored if the Publication Finder customer profile allows guest access in the environment where you are making the request.  For example, if you would like to make a request to PublicationIQ in the sandbox environment without a password, guest access must be enabled for the Publication Finder customer profile in the sandbox environment.  The same is true in the production environment.  This documentation uses the sandbox environment.  In order to gain access to the PublicationIQ sandbox environment, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: packageid
parameters.description: Package ID ex: 1073

parameters.name: profile
parameters.description: A valid EBSCO customer profile in the form of customerid.groupid.profileid.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Profile Password (optional). If a password is supplied, it must be a valid password assigned to the customer profile. If omitted, the request will only be honored if the customer profile allows guest access.

404.description: Package is hidden or not selected

get.description: This resource allows you to retrieve a publication by title ID.  Access to PublicationIQ requires a Publication Finder customer profile.  A profile password is optional.  If a password is supplied, it must be a valid password assigned to the Publication Finder customer profile.  If the password is omitted, the request will only be honored if the Publication Finder customer profile allows guest access in the environment where you are making the request.  For example, if you would like to make a request to PublicationIQ in the sandbox environment without a password, guest access must be enabled for the Publication Finder customer profile in the sandbox environment.  The same is true in the production environment.  This documentation uses the sandbox environment.  In order to gain access to the PublicationIQ sandbox environment, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: packageid
parameters.description: Package ID

parameters.name: kbid
parameters.description: Title ID

parameters.name: sessionid
parameters.description: Session ID.  If session ID is used, it will improve the experience of using the publications search.  sessionid is an optional parameter.

parameters.name: profile
parameters.description: A valid EBSCO customer profile in the form of customerid.groupid.profileid.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Profile Password (optional). If a password is supplied, it must be a valid password assigned to the customer profile. If omitted, the request will only be honored if the customer profile allows guest access.

get.summary: Deprecated - Get Publications by Specified Title Attributes
get.description: This resource has been deprecated in favor of /pf/v1/pfaccount/{profile}/publications.  This resource allows you to search for publications and returns a list of publications.  The list is limited to a single customer ID.  The response will reflect the context of the EBSCO customer ID included in the request.  Access to PublicationIQ requires a Publication Finder customer profile.  A profile password is optional.  If a password is supplied, it must be a valid password assigned to the Publication Finder customer profile.  If the password is omitted, the request will only be honored if the Publication Finder customer profile allows guest access in the environment where you are making the request.  For example, if you would like to make a request to PublicationIQ in the sandbox environment without a password, guest access must be enabled for the Publication Finder customer profile in the sandbox environment.  The same is true in the production environment.  This documentation uses the sandbox environment.  In order to gain access to the PublicationIQ sandbox environment, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: resourcetypefacet
parameters.description: Resource type facet filter. Limits the results.  resourcetypefacet is an optional parameter.

parameters.name: packagefacet
parameters.description: Package type facet filter. Limits the results.  packagefacet is an optional parameter.

parameters.name: subjectfacet
parameters.description: Subject type facet filter. Limits the results.  subjectfacet is an optional parameter.

parameters.name: sessionid
parameters.description: Session ID.  If session ID is used, it will improve the experience of using the publications search.  sessionid is an optional parameter.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Keyword search that is applied to limit the results to publications that have the search term in the title name.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Page Offset. Starts at 1.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return in the response. Maximum count value is 100.

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Valid values are titlename and relevance.

parameters.name: searchfield
parameters.description: Field to search. Valid values are titlename, subject, isxn or publisher.

parameters.name: includefacets
parameters.description: Specify **true** if search is required to include facet information, **false** otherwise.

parameters.name: searchtype
parameters.description: Type of search. Search types are any, contains, exactmatch, beginswith, proximity, exactphrase and advanced. Searchtype is an optional parameter and defaults to contains if not provided.

parameters.name: resourcetype
parameters.description: Type of resource. Valid values are Journal, Newsletter, Report, Proceedings, Web site, Newspaper, Unspecified, Book, Book Series, Database, Thesis/Dissertation, Streaming Audio, Streaming, Video or Audio Book.  resourcetype is an optional parameter.

parameters.name: alphamenufacet
parameters.description: Alpha Menu Facet facet filter. Limits the results.  alphamenufacet is an optional parameter.  One alphamenufacet is supported in a query.

parameters.name: ispeerreviewed
parameters.description: Specify **true** if search is required to include facet information for "isPeerReviewed" title metadata, **false** otherwise.

parameters.name: subjectfacetschemafilter
parameters.description: Specifies the schema to filter by for the subjects facet.  Valid values are tli, bisac, medical or library of congress.

parameters.name: subjectfacetcount
parameters.description: Maximum number of subject facets to be returned.

parameters.name: packagefacetcount
parameters.description: Maximum number of package facets to be returned.

parameters.name: alphamenufacetcount
parameters.description: Maximum number of alphamenu facets to be returned.

parameters.name: resourcetypefacetcount
parameters.description: Maximum number of resource type facets to be returned.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Source of the request.

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description: Platform that the search is made from.

parameters.name: profile
parameters.description: A valid EBSCO customer profile in the form of customerid.groupid.profileid.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Profile Password (optional).  If a password is supplied, it must be a valid password assigned to the customer profile.  If omitted, the request will only be honored if the customer profile allows guest access.

parameters.name: kbid
parameters.description: Title ID  Ex: 1385382

get.summary: Retrieve Singular Title Details for a Customer

200.description: OK, Title details for a given KBID

peerReviewed.description: Indicates if the title is peer reviewed or not

subtype.description: Sub-type for the identifier.  This is used by only some identifiers to designate Print, Online, etc.  Empty=0, Print=1, Online=2, Preceding=3, Succeeding=4, Regional=5, Linking=6 and Invalid=7

type.description: The type of subject.  Valid values are BISAC and TLI.

titleCustom.description: Is this a custom title owned by the customer.

pubType.description: Type of publication. Valid values are journal, newsletter, report, proceedings, website, newspaper, unspecified, book, bookseries, database, thesisdissertation, streamingaudio, streamingvideo, and audiobook.

type.description: Type of contributor. Valid values are Author, Illustrator, and Editor.

contributor.description: Type of publication. Valid values are journal, newsletter, report, proceedings, website, newspaper, unspecified, book, bookseries, database, thesisdissertation, streamingaudio, streamingvideo, and audiobook.

packageId.description: EBSCO KB's unique identifier for the package.  In EPKB, this is 'PkgID'.

packageName.description: Name of the Package. In EPKB, this is 'PkgName'.
packageName.example: Health & Wellness Resource Center (w/alt health module)

packageType.description: Package Type. Valid values are Selectable, Complete, Variable and Custom.

vendorId.description: EBSCO KB's unique identifier for the provider.  In EPKB, this is 'VendorID'.

vendorName.description: Provider name.  In EPKB, this is the 'VendorName'.

isSelected.description: Indicates if selected in a customer's account.

isTokenNeeded.description: Field to indicate if a token is needed

embargoUnit.description: The unit of time to use for the embargo - Days, Weeks, Months or Years.

embargoValue.description: The embargo value (number of embargoUnits).  A Null value means there is no embargo.

embargoUnit.description: The unit of time to use for the embargo - Days, Weeks, Months or Years.

embargoValue.description: The embargo value (number of embargoUnits).  A Null value means there is no embargo.

inherited.description: Field to indicate if the proxy is inherited.

noteText.description: Note text to be displayed on the menu

iconUrl.description: If customer uses own icon for a note, this is its URL.  Null if no icon or using standard icon

hoverText.description: Hover text to show on mouse-over for the note

linkUrl.description: URL of the note link if any

displayOnPublicationFinder.description: Is displayed on the Publication Finder

get.description: This operation allows you to search with an individual title and returns details associated with the individual title. The title is limited to a single customer ID. The response will reflect the context of the EBSCO customer ID included in the request.

parameters.name: sessionid
parameters.description: Session ID. If provided, improves the experience of using the publications search. sessionid is an optional parameter. Ex:'-2689046726050171609'

parameters.name: returnrelativeimagelinks
parameters.description: Return relative links or direct links to cover images

parameters.name: vendorid
parameters.description: Vendor ID. Ex: '134386'

parameters.name: packageid
parameters.description: Package ID. Ex: '4077736'

parameters.name: kbid
parameters.description: Title ID. Ex: '1385382'

get.description: This operation allows you to search for publications and returns a list of publications. The list is limited to a single customer ID. The response will reflect the context of the EBSCO customer ID included in the request.

parameters.name: alphamenufacetcount
parameters.description: Max count for alphamenu facets to be returned. e.g. '10'

parameters.name: highlighttag
parameters.description: HTML tag that determines styling of the item. e.g. 'mark'

parameters.name: linkfrom
parameters.description: Where external links are displayed on a web page. e.g. 'PublicationResultList'

parameters.name: packagefacet
parameters.description: Package Type Facet filtration option. Required in order to access specific titles via refined results. e.g. '4077736'

parameters.name: packagefacetcount
parameters.description: Max count for package facets to be returned. e.g. '10'

parameters.name: peerreviewed
parameters.description: Specify true if search is required to include facet information for "PeerReviewed" title metadata, false otherwise.

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description: Platform search is made from. e.g. 'AWS'

parameters.name: resourcetype
parameters.description: Type of resource. e.g. 'JOURNAL'

parameters.name: resourcetypefacet
parameters.description: Resource Type Facet filtration option. Required in order to access specific titles via refined results. e.g. 'JOURNAL'

parameters.name: resourcetypefacetcount
parameters.description: Max count for resource type facets to be returned. e.g. '10'

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Required to bound search result to specific search value. e.g. 'nature'

parameters.name: searchtype
parameters.description: Type of search. e.g. 'ANY'

parameters.name: sessionid
parameters.description: Already existing SessionId can be provided to improve experience of using the publications search. Example format -> '-2689046726050171609'

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Source of the request. e.g. 'pfi'

parameters.name: subjectfacetcount
parameters.description: Max count for subject facets to be returned. e.g. '10'

parameters.name: subjectfacetschemafilter
parameters.description: Specify the schema to filter the schema of the subjects facet. e.g. 'TLI'

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return in the response. Maximum allowed count value is 100. e.g. '10'

parameters.name: includefacets
parameters.description: Specify true if search is required to include facet information, false otherwise.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Page number. Starts from 1. e.g. '1'

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Order in which the publications will be returned. e.g. 'RELEVANCE'. Note that orderby will always be treated as 'TITLENAME' when the search term is blank.

parameters.name: searchfield
parameters.description: Field to search. e.g. 'TITLENAME'. The 'Contributor' search field is equivalent to the 'Author' search field in the EBSCO Publication Finder User Interface

parameters.name: alphamenufacet
parameters.description: Alpha Menu Facet filtration option. Required in order to access specific titles via refined results. Only 1 Alpha Menu Facet value supported in query. e.g. 'A'

parameters.name: returnrelativeimagelinks
parameters.description: Return relative links or direct links to cover images

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Cover image size. e.g. thumb

parameters.name: subjectfacet
parameters.description: Subject Type Facet filtration option. Required in order to access specific titles via refined results. e.g. 'Medical'

parameters.name: packagefreeaccess
parameters.description: Limits the results based on Package Free Access. The filter options are (true, false, all), and the default is all.

get.description: This resource allows you to retrieve an Alpha Browser menu by locale ID and resource type.  Access to PublicationIQ requires a Publication Finder customer profile.  A profile password is optional.  If a password is supplied, it must be a valid password assigned to the Publication Finder customer profile.  If the password is omitted, the request will only be honored if the Publication Finder customer profile allows guest access in the environment where you are making the request.  For example, if you would like to make a request to PublicationIQ in the sandbox environment without a password, guest access must be enabled for the Publication Finder customer profile in the sandbox environment.  The same is true in the production environment.  This documentation uses the sandbox environment.  In order to gain access to the PublicationIQ sandbox environment, please contact EBSCO customer support.

parameters.name: profile
parameters.description: EBSCO customer profile. e.g. 'demo.main.pfiguest'

parameters.name: localeid
parameters.description: Locale identifier. e.g. '1033'

parameters.name: sessionid
parameters.description: Already existing SessionId can be provided to improve experience of using the publications search. Example format '-2689046726050171609'

parameters.name: resourcetype
parameters.description: Resource type filter for alpha browser response. e.g. 'JOURNAL' only applies to title search type

parameters.name: searchtype
parameters.description: Search type filter for alpha browser response. e.g. 'PACKAGE'

parameters.name: menuid
parameters.description: Menu id. Used for filtering menus in position 1. Should be a positive number. e.g. '65'

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Profile Password (optional). If a password is supplied, it must be a valid password assigned to the customer profile. If omitted, the request will only be honored if the customer profile allows guest access.

parameters.name: sessionid
parameters.description: If provided, improves the experience of using the publications search. Sessionid is an optional parameter.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Keyword search that is applied to limit the results to packages that have the search term in the package name.

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Valid values are packagename and relevance. Note that orderby will always be treated as 'packagename' when the search term is blank.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Page Offset. Starts at 1.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return in the response. Maximum count value is 100.

parameters.name: contenttype
parameters.description: Limits the results by type of package content. Valid values are all, aggregatedfulltext, abstractandindex, ebook, ejournal, print, unknown and onlinereference. It is also valid to use 0 for all, 1 for aggregated full text, 2 for abstract and index, 3 for ebook, 4 for ejournal, 5 for print, 6 for unknown or 7 for online reference.

parameters.name: searchtype
parameters.description: Type of search. Search types are any, contains, exactmatch, beginswith, exactphrase and advanced. Searchtype is an optional parameter and defaults to contains if not provided.

parameters.name: searchfield
parameters.description: Field to search. e.g. 'KEYWORKD'.

parameters.name: subjectfacetcount
parameters.description: Max count for subject facets to be returned. e.g. '10'

parameters.name: subjectfacetschemafilter
parameters.description: Specify the schema to filter the schema of the subjects facet.

parameters.name: includefacets
parameters.description: Specify **true** if search is required to include facet information, **false** otherwise.

parameters.name: subjectfacet
parameters.description: Subject Type Facet filtration option. Required in order to access specific titles via refined results. e.g. 'Medical'

parameters.name: alphamenufacet
parameters.description: Alpha Menu Facet filtration option. Required in order to access specific titles via refined results. Only 1 Alpha Menu Facet value supported in query. e.g. 'A'

parameters.name: categoryfacet
parameters.description: Filters package search results by given categories. Accepts category id or name. If multiple categories are given, packages assigned to any of the given categories will be returned. Example: 4672.

get.description: This resource allows you to search for packages and returns a list of packages from EPKB. The list is limited to a single customer ID. The response will reflect the context of the EBSCO customer ID included in the request.  Access to PublicationIQ requires a Publication Finder customer profile.  A profile password is optional.  If a password is supplied, it must be a valid password assigned to the Publication Finder customer profile.  If the password is omitted, the request will only be honored if the Publication Finder customer profile allows guest access in the environment where you are making the request.  For example, if you would like to make a request to PublicationIQ in the sandbox environment without a password, guest access must be enabled for the Publication Finder customer profile in the sandbox environment.  The same is true in the production environment.  This documentation uses the sandbox environment.  In order to gain access to the PublicationIQ sandbox environment, please contact EBSCO customer support.

type.description: The type of subject.  Valid values are BISAC and TLI.

embargoUnit.description: The unit of time to use for the embargo - Days, Weeks, Months or Years.

embargoValue.description: The embargo value (number of embargoUnits).  A Null value means there is no embargo.

type.description: Type of contributor. Valid values are Author, Illustrator, and Editor.

contentType.description: Content type. Valid values are All, AggregatedFullText, AbstractandIndex, EBook, EJournal, Print, Unknown and OnlineReference.

isCustom.description: isCustom is true if a customer is the vendor.  The customer vendor is used for custom packages.

isSelected.description: Indicates if the packages is selected in a customer's account.

isTokenNeeded.description: Field to indicate if a token is needed

packageType.description: Package Type.  Valid values are Selectable, Complete, Variable and Custom.

selectedCount.description: Numeric value indicating the number of titles in packages selected in the customer account.

titleCount.description: Numeric value indicating the title count of the package.

vendorId.description: EBSCO KB's unique identifier for the provider.  In EPKB, this is 'VendorID'.

vendorName.description: Provider name.  In EPKB, this is the 'VendorName'.

ResourceTypes.description: Resource Type.  Valid values are all, journal, newsletter, report, proceedings, website, newspaper, unspecified, book, bookseries, database, thesisdissertation, streamingaudio, streamingvideo, and audiobook.

packageId.description: EBSCO KB's unique identifier for the package.  In EPKB, this is 'PkgID'.

packageName.description: Name of the Package. In EPKB, this is 'PkgName'.
packageName.example: Health & Wellness Resource Center (w/alt health module)

packageType.description: Package Type. Valid values are Selectable, Complete, Variable and Custom.

vendorId.description: EBSCO KB's unique identifier for the provider.  In EPKB, this is 'VendorID'.

vendorName.description: Provider name.  In EPKB, this is the 'VendorName'.

isSelected.description: Indicates if selected in a customer's account.

isTokenNeeded.description: Field to indicate if a token is needed

isTitleCustom.description: Is this a custom title owned by the customer.

pubType.description: Type of publication. Valid values are journal, newsletter, report, proceedings, website, newspaper, unspecified, book, bookseries, database, thesisdissertation, streamingaudio, streamingvideo, and audiobook.

RecordFormat.description: Record Format.  The format of the record (e.g., HTML, PDF, Video, etc.)

noteText.description: Note text to be displayed on the menu

iconUrl.description: If customer uses own icon for a note, this is its URL.  Null if no icon or using standard icon

hoverText.description: Hover text to show on mouse-over for the note

linkUrl.description: URL of the note link if any

name.description: Indicates whether the given facet count is the count of free access packages or non free access packages

parentId.description: The ID of the parent caregory

subtype.description: Sub-type for the identifier.  This is used by only some identifiers to designate Print, Online, etc.  Empty=0, Print=1, Online=2, Preceding=3, Succeeding=4, Regional=5, Linking=6 and Invalid=7

displayOnPublicationFinder.description: Is displayed on the Publication Finder

contentType.description: Content type. Valid values are All, AggregatedFullText, AbstractandIndex, EBook, EJournal, Print, Unknown and OnlineReference.

Password.name: password
Password.description: Profile Password (optional).  If a password is supplied, it must be a valid password assigned to the customer profile.  If omitted, the request will only be honored if the customer profile allows guest access.
